text: New Braunfels (i/ˌnjuː ˈbrɔːnfəlz/ newbrawn-fəlz) is a city in Comal and Guadalupe counties in the U.S. state of Texas. It is the seat of Comal County. New Braunfels is a principal city of the San Antonio–New Braunfels metropolitan statistical area. The city's population was 90,403 at the 2020 census. New Braunfels is northeast of downtown San Antonio. It is southwest of San Marcos, and southwest of Austin. New Braunfels was established in 1845 by Prince Carl of Solms-Braunfels. Prince Solms named the settlement in honor of his home in Solms-Braunfels, Germany. The city has a strong German influence. This is seen in the downtown area architecture. The city uses ZIP codes 78130–78133 and telephone area code (830). == References == == Other websites == * New Braunfels official website * New Braunfels History; YouTube Category:Cities in Texas Category:County seats in Texas Category:1845 establishments in the United States Category:1840s establishments in Texas
title: New Braunfels, Texas
